data.title: The Twilight Zone (1959–1964)
data.summary: Ordinary people find themselves in extraordinarily astounding situations, which they each try to solve in a remarkable manner.

data.title: Firefly (2002–2003)
data.summary: Five hundred years in the future, a renegade crew aboard a small spacecraft tries to survive as they travel the unknown parts of the galaxy and evade warring factions as well as authority agents out to get them.

data.title: Westworld (2016– )
data.summary: Set at the intersection of the near future and the reimagined past, explore a world in which every human appetite can be indulged without consequence.

data.title: Stranger Things (2016– )
data.summary: When a young boy disappears, his mother, a police chief, and his friends must confront terrifying forces in order to get him back.

data.title: Black Mirror (2011– )
data.summary: An anthology series exploring a twisted, high-tech world where humanity's greatest innovations and darkest instincts collide.

data.title: Doctor Who (2005– )
data.summary: The further adventures in time and space of the alien adventurer known as the Doctor, a Time Lord/Lady who can change appearance and gender by regenerating when near death, and their human companions.

data.title: Daredevil (2015– )
data.summary: Matt Murdock, with his other senses superhumanly enhanced, fights crime as a blind lawyer by day, and vigilante by night.

data.title: The X Files (1993– )
data.summary: Two F.B.I. Agents, Fox Mulder the believer and Dana Scully the skeptic, investigate the strange and unexplained, while hidden forces work to impede their efforts.

data.title: The Punisher (2017– )
data.summary: After the murder of his family, Marine veteran Frank Castle became a vigilante known as "The Punisher" with only one goal in mind, to avenge them.

data.title: Battlestar Galactica (2004–2009)
data.summary: When an old enemy, the Cylons, resurface and obliterate the 12 colonies, the crew of the aged Galactica protect a small civilian fleet - the last of humanity - as they journey toward the fabled 13th colony, Earth.

data.title: The Handmaid's Tale (2017– )
data.summary: Set in a dystopian future, a woman is forced to live as a concubine under a fundamentalist theocratic dictatorship.

data.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation (1987–1994)
data.summary: Set decades after Captain Kirk's five-year mission, a new generation of Starfleet officers set off in a new Enterprise on their own mission to go where no one has gone before.

data.title: Dark (2017– )
data.summary: A family saga with a supernatural twist, set in a German town, where the disappearance of two young children exposes the relationships among four families.

data.title: The Walking Dead (2010– )
data.summary: Sheriff Deputy Rick Grimes wakes up from a coma to learn the world is in ruins, and must lead a group of survivors to stay alive.

data.title: The Expanse (2015– )
data.summary: A police detective in the asteroid belt, the first officer of an interplanetary ice freighter and an earth-bound United Nations executive slowly discover a vast conspiracy that threatens the Earth's rebellious colony on the asteroid belt.

data.title: Lost (2004–2010)
data.summary: The survivors of a plane crash are forced to work together in order to survive on a seemingly deserted tropical island.

data.title: Stargate SG-1 (1997–2007)
data.summary: A secret military team, SG-1, is formed to explore other planets through the recently discovered Stargates.

data.title: Legion (2017– )
data.summary: David Haller is a troubled young man diagnosed as schizophrenic, but after a strange encounter, he discovers special powers that will change his life forever.

data.title: Person of Interest (2011–2016)
data.summary: An ex-assassin and a wealthy programmer save lives via a surveillance AI that sends them the identities of civilians involved in impending crimes. However, the details of the crimes--including the civilians' roles--are left a mystery.

data.title: Sense8 (2015–2018)
data.summary: A group of people around the world are suddenly linked mentally, and must find a way to survive being hunted by those who see them as a threat to the world's order.

data.title: Fringe (2008–2013)
data.summary: An F.B.I. agent is forced to work with an institutionalized scientist and his son in order to rationalize a brewing storm of unexplained phenomena.

data.title: Star Trek (1966–1969)
data.summary: Captain James T. Kirk and the crew of the Starship Enterprise explore the galaxy and defend the United Federation of Planets.

data.title: Orphan Black (2013–2017)
data.summary: A streetwise hustler is pulled into a compelling conspiracy after witnessing the suicide of a girl who looks just like her.

data.title: Altered Carbon (2018– )
data.summary: Set in a future where consciousness is digitized and stored, a prisoner returns to life in a new body and must solve a mind-bending murder to win his freedom.
A high school teacher travels back in time to prevent John F. Kennedy's assassination.

data.title: The Man in the High Castle (2015– )
data.summary: A glimpse into an alternate history of North America. What life after WWII may have been like if the Nazis had won the war.

data.title: Jessica Jones (2015– )
data.summary: Following the tragic end of her brief superhero career, Jessica Jones tries to rebuild her life as a private investigator, dealing with cases involving people with remarkable abilities in New York City.

data.title: Stargate: Atlantis (2004–2009)
data.summary: An international team of scientists and military personnel discover a Stargate network in the Pegasus Galaxy and come face-to-face with a new, powerful enemy, The Wraith.

data.title: Counterpart (2017– )
data.summary: A hapless UN employee discovers the agency he works for is hiding a gateway to a parallel dimension that's in Cold War with our own, and where his other self is a top spy. The war slowly heats up thanks to spies from both sides.

data.title: The Flash (2014– )
data.summary: After being struck by lightning, Barry Allen wakes up from his coma to discover he's been given the power of super speed, becoming the Flash, fighting crime in Central City.

data.title: Humans (2015– )
data.summary: In a parallel present where the latest must-have gadget for any busy family is a 'Synth' - a highly-developed robotic servant that's so similar to a real human it's transforming the way we live.

data.title: Travelers (2016– )
data.summary: Hundreds of years from now, surviving humans discover how to send consciousness back through time, into people of the 21st century, while attempting to change the path of humanity.

data.title: Gotham (2014– )
data.summary: The story behind Detective James Gordon's rise to prominence in Gotham City in the years before Batman's arrival.

data.title: The Orville (2017– )
data.summary: Follows the crew of the not-so-functional exploratory ship in the Earth's interstellar fleet, 400 years in the future.

data.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine (1993–1999)
data.summary: In the vicinity of the liberated planet of Bajor, the Federation space station Deep Space Nine guards the opening of a stable wormhole to the far side of the galaxy.

data.title: Eureka (2006–2012)
data.summary: A U.S. Marshall becomes the sheriff of a remote cozy little Northwestern town of Eureka where the best minds in the US have secretly been tucked away to build futuristic inventions for the government which often go disastrously wrong.

data.title: Future Man (2017– )
data.summary: Josh Futturman, a janitor by day and a gamer by night, is recruited by mysterious visitors to travel through time to prevent the extinction of humanity.

data.title: The 100 (2014– )
data.summary: Set ninety-seven years after a nuclear war has destroyed civilization, when a spaceship housing humanity's lone survivors sends one hundred juvenile delinquents back to Earth, in hopes of possibly re-populating the planet.

data.title: The OA (2016– )
data.summary: Having gone missing seven years ago, the previously blind Prairie returns home, now in her twenties with her sight restored. While many believe she is a miracle, others worry that she could be dangerous.

data.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun (1996–2001)
data.summary: A group of aliens are sent to Earth, disguised as a human family, to experience and report life on the 3rd planet from the sun.

data.title: Limitless (2015–2016)
data.summary: An average twenty-eight-year-old man who gains the ability to use the full extent of his brain's capabilities is hired by the F.B.I. as a consultant.

data.title: Arrow (2012– )
data.summary: Spoiled billionaire playboy Oliver Queen is missing and presumed dead when his yacht is lost at sea. He returns five years later a changed man, determined to clean up the city as a hooded vigilante armed with a bow.

data.title: 12 Monkeys (2015–2018)
data.summary: Follows the journey of a time traveler from the post-apocalyptic future who appears in present day on a mission to locate and eradicate the source of a deadly plague that will nearly destroy the human race.

data.title: Star Trek: Voyager (1995–2001)
data.summary: Pulled to the far side of the galaxy, where the Federation is seventy-five years away at maximum warp speed, a Starfleet ship must cooperate with Maquis rebels to find a way home.

data.title: Timeless (2016–2018)
data.summary: An unlikely trio travel through time in order to battle unknown criminals and protect history as we know it.

data.title: The Gifted (2017– )
data.summary: In a world where mutated humans are treated with distrust and fear, an institute for mutants battles to achieve peaceful co-existence with humanity.

data.title: Heroes (II) (2006–2010)
data.summary: Common people discover that they have super powers. Their lives intertwine as a devastating event must be prevented.

data.title: Alias (2001–2006)
data.summary: Sydney Bristow is an international spy recruited out of college, trained for espionage and self-defense.

data.title: Warehouse 13 (2009–2014)
data.summary: After saving the life of the President in Washington D.C., a pair of U.S Secret Service agents are whisked away to a covert location in South Dakota that houses supernatural objects that ...                See full summary »

data.title: Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. (2013– )
data.summary: The missions of the Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division.

data.title: Luke Cage (2016– )
data.summary: When a sabotaged experiment gives him super strength and unbreakable skin, Luke Cage becomes a fugitive attempting to rebuild his life in Harlem and must soon confront his past and fight a battle for the heart of his city.

data.title: The Last Ship (2014– )
data.summary: The crew of a naval destroyer is forced to confront the reality of a new existence when a pandemic kills off most of the earth's population.

data.title: Smallville (2001–2011)
data.summary: A young Clark Kent struggles to find his place in the world as he learns to harness his alien powers for good and deals with the typical troubles of teenage life in Smallville, Kansas.

data.title: Enterprise (2001–2005)
data.summary: A century before Captain Kirk's five-year mission, Jonathan Archer captains the United Earth ship Enterprise during the early years of Starfleet, leading up to the Earth-Romulan War and the formation of the Federation.

data.title: The Defenders (2017– )
data.summary: Set a few months after the events of the second season of Daredevil, and a month after the events of Iron Fist, the vigilantes Daredevil, Jessica Jones, Luke Cage, and Iron Fist team up in New York City to fight a common enemy: The Hand.

data.title: Dark Matter (2015–2017)
data.summary: In the dystopian 27th century, six people wake up on a deserted spaceship with no memory of who they are or what they're doing there. They reluctantly team up and set off to find answers with the help of a female android.

data.title: Star Trek: Discovery (2017– )
data.summary: Ten years before Kirk, Spock and the Enterprise, the USS Discovery discovers new worlds and lifeforms as one Starfleet officer learns to understand all things alien.

data.title: The Last Man on Earth (2015–2018)
data.summary: Almost two years after a virus wiped out most of the human race, Phil Miller only wishes for some company, but soon gets more than he bargained for when that company shows up in the form of other survivors.

data.title: Colony (2016–2018)
data.summary: In the wake of a mysterious alien invasion, a family fights to stay together in a new world order.

data.title: Runaways (2017– )
data.summary: After discovering their parents are super-villains in disguise, a group of teenagers band together to run away from their homes in order to atone for their parents' actions and to discover the secrets of their origins.

data.title: The Shannara Chronicles (2016– )
data.summary: Series of adventures, war, and evil that occur throughout the history of the Four Lands.

data.title: The Crossing (2018)
data.summary: Refugees from a war-torn country 180 years in the future start showing up in the present to seek asylum in an American town.

data.title: Electric Dreams (2017– )
data.summary: A sci-fi anthology series with stand-alone episodes based on the works of Philip K. Dick.

data.title: Ghoul (2018– )
data.summary: In a totalitarian near-future India, a mysterious prisoner is sent to a remote military interrogation center where he turns the tables on his captors by exposing their most shameful secrets and unleashing a demon from Arabic folklore.

data.title: Lost in Space (2018– )
data.summary: After crash-landing on an alien planet, the Robinson family fight against all odds to survive and escape, but they're surrounded by hidden dangers.

data.title: Killjoys (2015– )
data.summary: In the Quad, a planetary system on the brink of a bloody interplanetary class war, a fun loving trio of bounty hunters attempt to remain impartial as they chase deadly warrants.

data.title: Stan Lee's Lucky Man (2016– )
data.summary: From the mind of comic book legend Stan Lee comes a bold new action crime series about a brilliant but flawed police officer with the power to control luck.

data.title: Krypton (2018– )
data.summary: The untold story of Superman's grandfather as he fights for justice on his home planet.

data.title: Fear the Walking Dead (2015– )
data.summary: A Walking Dead spin-off, set in Los Angeles, following two families who must band together to survive the undead apocalypse.

data.title: Cloak & Dagger (2018– )
data.summary: Two teenagers from very different backgrounds find themselves burdened and awakened to newly acquired superpowers while falling in love.

data.title: Salvation (2017– )
data.summary: An MIT grad student and a tech superstar bring a low-level Pentagon official a staggering discovery--that an asteroid is just six months away from colliding with Earth.

data.title: Legends of Tomorrow (2016– )
data.summary: Time-traveling rogue Rip Hunter has to recruit a rag-tag team of heroes and villains to help prevent an apocalypse that could impact not only Earth, but all of time.

data.title: Iron Fist (2017– )
data.summary: A young man is bestowed with incredible martial arts skills and a mystical force known as the Iron Fist.

data.title: Z Nation (2014– )
data.summary: Three years after the zombie virus has gutted the United States of America a team of everyday heroes must transport the only known survivor of the plague from New York to California, where the last functioning viral lab waits for his blood.

data.title: Under the Dome (2013–2015)
data.summary: An invisible and mysterious force field descends upon a small actual town of Chester's Mill, Maine, USA, trapping residents inside, cut off from the rest of civilization. The trapped townspeople must discover the secrets and purpose of the "dome" or "sphere" and its origins, while coming to learn more than they ever knew about each other and animals too.

data.title: Reverie (2018– )
data.summary: A former hostage negotiator takes a job retrieving people who are lost in a virtual reality program.

data.title: Supergirl (2015– )
data.summary: The adventures of Superman's cousin in her own superhero career.

data.title: The Purge (2018– )
data.summary: Set in an altered United States, several unrelated people discover how far they will go to survive a night where all crime is legal for 12 hours.

data.title: Black Lightning (2018– )
data.summary: A crusading school principal gets back into action as the original African-American electrical superhero.

data.title: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers (1993–1999)
data.summary: A team of teenagers with attitude are recruited to save Angel Grove from the evil witch, Rita Repulsa, and later, Lord Zedd, Emperor of all he sees, and their horde of monsters.

data.title: The Innocents (2018– )
data.summary: When teenagers Harry and June run away from their repressive families to be together, they're derailed by an extraordinary discovery - June's ability to shape-shift. A scientist tries to capture her and discover the key to her power.

data.title: The Rain (I) (2018– )
data.summary: After a brutal virus wipes out most of the population, two young siblings embark on a perilous search for safety.

data.title: The First (2018– )
data.summary: Fictional series to chronicle the effort to send the first crewed mission to Mars.

data.title: Titans (I) (2018– )
data.summary: A team of young superheroes led by Nightwing (formerly Batman's first Robin) form to combat evil and other perils.

data.title: Maniac (2018– )
data.summary: Two strangers are drawn to a mysterious pharmaceutical trial that will, they're assured, with no complications or side-effects whatsoever, solve all of their problems, permanently. Things do not go as planned.

data.title: Doom Patrol (2019– )
data.summary: The adventures of an idealistic mad scientist and his field team of superpowered outcasts.
